body:
# Added

* Added a new NLP model task type "auto" which infers the task type based on model configuration and architecture  (#475)

# Changed

* Changed required version of 'torch' package to `>=1.11.0,<1.12` to match required PyTorch version for Elasticsearch 8.3 (was `>=1.9.0,<2`) (#479)
* Changed the default value of the `--task-type` parameter for the `eland_import_hub_model` CLI to be "auto" (#475)

# Fixed

* Fixed decision tree classifier serialization to account for probabilities (#465)
* Fixed PyTorch model quantization (#472)

# Added

* Added support for passing Cloud ID via ``--cloud-id`` to ``eland_import_hub_model`` CLI tool (#462)
* Added support for authenticating via ``--es-username``, ``--es-password``, and ``--es-api-key`` to the ``eland_import_hub_model`` CLI tool (#461)
* Added support for XGBoost 1.6 (#458)
* Added support for ``question_answering`` NLP tasks (#457)

# Added

* Added support for ``eland.Series.unique()`` (#448, contributed by @V1NAY8)
* Added ``--ca-certs`` and ``--insecure`` options to ``eland_import_hub_model`` for configuring TLS (#441)

# Added

* Added support for Natural Language Processing (NLP) models using PyTorch (#394)
* Added new extra `eland[pytorch]` for installing all dependencies needed for PyTorch (#394)
* Added a CLI script `eland_import_hub_model` for uploading HuggingFace models to Elasticsearch (#403)
* Added support for v8.0 of the Python Elasticsearch client (#415)
* Added a warning if Eland detects it's communicating with an incompatible Elasticsearch version (#419)
* Added support for ``number_samples`` to LightGBM and Scikit-Learn models (#397, contributed by @V1NAY8)
* Added ability to use datetime types for filtering dataframes (#284, contributed by @Fju)
* Added pandas ``datetime64`` type to use the Elasticsearch `date` type (#425, contributed by @Ashton-Sidhu)
* Added ``es_verify_mapping_compatibility`` parameter to disable schema enforcement with `pandas_to_eland` (#423, contributed by @Ashton-Sidhu)

# Changed

* Changed `to_pandas()` to only use Point-in-Time and `search_after` instead of using Scroll APIs for pagination.

name: 8.0.0-beta1
body:
# Added

* Added support for Natural Language Processing (NLP) models using PyTorch (https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/394)
* Added new extra ``eland[pytorch]`` for installing all dependencies needed for PyTorch (https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/394)
* Added a CLI script ``eland_import_hub_model`` for uploading HuggingFace models to Elasticsearch (https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/403)
* Added support for v8.0 of the Python Elasticsearch client (https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/415)
* Added a warning if Eland detects it's communicating with an incompatible Elasticsearch version (https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/419)
* Added support for ``number_samples`` to LightGBM and Scikit-Learn models (https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/397, contributed by @V1NAY8)

# Changed

* Changed ``to_pandas()`` to only use Point-in-Time and ``search_after`` instead of using Scroll APIs
  for pagination.

name: 7.14.1b1
body:
## Added

* Added support for ``DataFrame.iterrows()`` and ``DataFrame.itertuples()`` ([#380](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/380), contributed by @kxbin)

## Performance

* Simplified result collectors to increase performance transforming Elasticsearch results to pandas ([#378](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/378), contributed by @V1NAY8)
* Changed search pagination function to yield batches of hits ([#379](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/379))

name: 7.14.0b1
body:
## Added

* Added support for Pandas 1.3.x ([#362](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/362), contributed by @V1NAY8)
* Added support for LightGBM 3.x ([#362](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/362), contributed by @V1NAY8)
* Added ``DataFrame.idxmax()`` and ``DataFrame.idxmin()`` methods ([#353](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/353), contributed by @V1NAY8)
* Added type hints to ``eland.ndframe`` and ``eland.operations`` ([#366](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/366), contributed by @V1NAY8)

## Removed

* Removed support for Pandas <1.2 ([#364](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/364))
* Removed support for Python 3.6 to match Pandas ([#364](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/364))

## Changed

* Changed paginated search function to use [Point-in-Time](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/point-in-time-api.html) and [Search After](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/paginate-search-results.html#search-after) features instead of Scroll when connected to Elasticsearch 7.12+ ([#370](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/370) and [#376](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/376), contributed by @V1NAY8)
* Optimized the ``FieldMappings.aggregate_field_name()`` method ([#373](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/373), contributed by @V1NAY8)

name: 7.13.0b1
body:
## Added

* Added ``DataFrame.quantile()``, ``Series.quantile()``, and ``DataFrameGroupBy.quantile()`` aggregations ([#318](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/318) and [#356](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/356), contributed by @V1NAY8)

## Changed

* Changed the error raised when ``es_index_pattern`` doesn't point to any indices to be more user-friendly ([#346](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/346))

## Fixed

* Fixed a warning about conflicting field types when wildcards are used in ``es_index_pattern`` ([#346](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/346))
* Fixed sorting when using ``DataFrame.groupby()`` with ``dropna`` ([#322](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/322), contributed by @V1NAY8)
* Fixed deprecated usage ``numpy.int`` in favor of ``numpy.int_`` ([#354](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/354), contributed by @V1NAY8)

name: 7.10.1b1
body:
## Added

* Added support for Pandas 1.2.0 ([#336](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/336))

* Added ``DataFrame.mode()`` and ``Series.mode()`` aggregation ([#323](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/323), contributed by @V1NAY8)

* Added support for ``pd.set_option("display.max_rows", None)``
  ([#308](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/308), contributed by @V1NAY8)

* Added Elasticsearch storage usage to ``df.info()`` ([#321](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/321), contributed by @V1NAY8)

## Removed

* Removed deprecated aliases ``read_es``, ``read_csv``, ``DataFrame.info_es``,
  and ``MLModel(overwrite=True)`` ([#331](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/331), contributed by @V1NAY8)

name: 7.10.0b1
body:
## Added

* Added `DataFrame.groupby()` method with all aggregations ([#278](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/278), [#291](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/291), [#292](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/292), [#300](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/300) contributed by @V1NAY8)

* Added `es_match()` method to `DataFrame` and `Series` for filtering rows with full-text search ([#301](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/301))

* Added support for type hints of the `elasticsearch-py` package ([#295](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/295))

* Added support for passing dictionaries to `es_type_overrides` parameter in the `pandas_to_eland()` function to directly control the field mapping generated in Elasticsearch ([#310](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/310))

* Added `es_dtypes` property to `DataFrame` and `Series` ([#285](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/285)) 

## Changed

* Changed `pandas_to_eland()` to use the `parallel_bulk()` helper instead of single-threaded `bulk()` helper to improve performance ([#279](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/279), contributed by @V1NAY8)

* Changed the `es_type_overrides` parameter in `pandas_to_eland()` to raise `ValueError` if an unknown column is given ([#302](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/302))

* Changed `DataFrame.filter()` to preserve the order of items ([#283](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/283), contributed by @V1NAY8)

* Changed when setting `es_type_overrides={"column": "text"}` in `pandas_to_eland()` will automatically add the `column.keyword` sub-field so that aggregations are available for the field as well ([#310](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/310))

## Fixed

* Fixed `Series.__repr__` when the series is empty ([#306](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/306))

name: 7.9.1a1
body:
## Added

* Added the ``predict()`` method and ``model_type``, ``feature_names``, and ``results_field`` properties to ``MLModel``  ([#266](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/266))


## Deprecated

* Deprecated ``ImportedMLModel`` in favor of ``MLModel.import_model(...)`` ([#266](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/266))


## Changed

* Changed DataFrame aggregations to use ``numeric_only=None`` instead of ``numeric_only=True`` by default. This is the same behavior as Pandas ([#270](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/270), contributed by @V1NAY8)

## Fixed

* Fixed ``DataFrame.agg()`` when given a string instead of a list of aggregations will now properly return a ``Series`` instead of a ``DataFrame`` ([#263](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/263), contributed by @V1NAY8)

name: 7.9.0a1
body:
# 7.9.0a1 (2020-08-18)

## Added

* Added support for Pandas v1.1 ([#253](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/253))
* Added support for LightGBM ``LGBMRegressor`` and ``LGBMClassifier`` to ``ImportedMLModel`` ([#247](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/247), [#252](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/252))
* Added support for ``multi:softmax`` and ``multi:softprob`` XGBoost operators to ``ImportedMLModel`` ([#246](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/246))
* Added column names to ``DataFrame.__dir__()`` for better auto-completion support ([#223](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/223), contributed by @leonardbinet)
* Added support for ``es_if_exists='append'`` to ``pandas_to_eland()`` ([#217](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/217))
* Added support for aggregating datetimes with ``nunique`` and ``mean`` ([#253](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/253))
* Added ``es_compress_model_definition`` parameter to ``ImportedMLModel`` constructor ([#220](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/220))
* Added ``.size`` and ``.ndim`` properties to ``DataFrame`` and ``Series`` ([#231](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/231) and [#233](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/233))
* Added ``.dtype`` property to ``Series`` ([#258](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/258))
* Added support for using ``pandas.Series`` with ``Series.isin()`` ([#231](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/231))
* Added type hints to many APIs in ``DataFrame`` and ``Series`` ([#231](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/231))

## Deprecated

* Deprecated  the ``overwrite`` parameter in favor of ``es_if_exists`` in ``ImportedMLModel`` constructor ([#249](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/249), contributed by @V1NAY8)

## Changed

* Changed aggregations for datetimes to be higher precision when available ([#253](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/253))

## Fixed

* Fixed ``ImportedMLModel.predict()`` to fail when ``errors`` are present in the ``ingest.simulate`` response ([#220](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/220))
* Fixed ``Series.median()`` aggregation to return a scalar instead of ``pandas.Series`` ([#253](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/253))
* Fixed ``Series.describe()`` to return a ``pandas.Series`` instead of ``pandas.DataFrame`` ([#258](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/258))
* Fixed ``DataFrame.mean()`` and ``Series.mean()`` dtype ([#258](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/258))
* Fixed ``DataFrame.agg()`` aggregations when using ``extended_stats`` Elasticsearch aggregation ([#253](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/253))

name: 7.7.0a1
body:
# 7.7.0a1 (2020-05-20)

## Added

* Added the package to Conda Forge, install via
  ``conda install -c conda-forge eland`` ([#209](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/209))
* Added ``DataFrame.sample()`` and ``Series.sample()`` for querying
  a random sample of data from the index ([#196](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/196), contributed by @mesejo)
* Added ``Series.isna()`` and ``Series.notna()`` for filtering out
  missing, ``NaN`` or null values from a column ([#210](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/210), contributed by @mesejo)
* Added ``DataFrame.filter()`` and ``Series.filter()`` for reducing an axis
  using a sequence of items or a pattern ([#212](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/212))
* Added ``DataFrame.to_pandas()`` and ``Series.to_pandas()`` for converting
  an Eland dataframe or series into a Pandas dataframe or series inline ([#208](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/208))
* Added support for XGBoost v1.0.0 ([#200](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/200))

## Deprecated

* Deprecated ``info_es()`` in favor of ``es_info()`` ([#208](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/208))
* Deprecated ``eland.read_csv()`` in favor of ``eland.csv_to_eland()`` ([#208](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/208))
* Deprecated ``eland.read_es()`` in favor of ``eland.DataFrame()`` ([#208](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/208))

## Changed

* Changed ``var`` and ``std`` aggregations to use sample instead of
  population in line with Pandas ([#185](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/185))
* Changed painless scripts to use ``source`` rather than ``inline`` to improve
  script caching performance ([#191](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/191), contributed by @mesejo)
* Changed minimum ``elasticsearch`` Python library version to v7.7.0 ([#207](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/207))
* Changed name of ``Index.field_name`` to ``Index.es_field_name`` ([#208](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/208))

## Fixed

* Fixed ``DeprecationWarning`` raised from ``pandas.Series`` when an
  an empty series was created without specifying ``dtype`` ([#188](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/188), contributed by @mesejo)
* Fixed a bug when filtering columns on complex combinations of and and or ([#204](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/204))
* Fixed an issue where ``DataFrame.shape`` would return a larger value than
  in the index if a sized operation like ``.head(X)`` was applied to the data
  frame ([#205](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/205), contributed by @mesejo)
* Fixed issue where both ``scikit-learn`` and ``xgboost`` libraries were
  required to use ``eland.ml.ImportedMLModel``, now only one library is
  required to use this feature ([#206](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/206))

name: 7.6.0a5
body:
# 7.6.0a5 (2020-04-14)

## Added

* Added support for Pandas v1.0.0 ([#141](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/141), contributed by @mesejo)
* Added ``use_pandas_index_for_es_ids`` parameter to ``pandas_to_eland()`` ([#154](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/154))
* Added ``es_type_overrides`` parameter to ``pandas_to_eland()`` ([#181](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/181))
* Added ``NDFrame.var()``, ``.std()`` and ``.median()`` aggregations ([#175](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/175), [#176](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/176), contributed by @mesejo)
* Added ``DataFrame.es_query()`` to allow modifying ES queries directly ([#156](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/156))
* Added ``eland.__version__`` ([#153](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/153), contributed by @mesejo)

## Changed

* Changed ML model serialization to be slightly smaller ([#159](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/159))
* Changed minimum ``elasticsearch`` Python library version to v7.6.0 ([#181](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/181))

## Fixed

* Fixed ``inference_config`` being required on ML models for ES >=7.8 ([#174](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/174))
* Fixed unpacking for ``DataFrame.aggregate("median")`` ([#161](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/161))

## Removed

* Removed support for Python 3.5 ([#150](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/150))
* Removed ``eland.Client()`` interface, use
  ``elasticsearch.Elasticsearch()`` client instead ([#166](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/166))
* Removed all private objects from top-level ``eland`` namespace ([#170](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/170))
* Removed ``geo_points`` from ``pandas_to_eland()`` in favor of ``es_type_overrides`` ([#181](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/181))


"""

name: 7.6.0a4
body:
# 7.6.0a4 (2020-03-23)

## Fixed
* Fixed issue in ``DataFrame.info()`` when called on an empty frame ([#135](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/135))
* Fixed issues where many ``_source`` fields would generate a ``too_long_frame`` error ([#135](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/135), [#137](https://github.com/elastic/eland/pull/135))

## Changed
* Changed requirement for ``xgboost`` from ``>=0.90`` to ``==0.90``
